Name: Inclusive Action for the City - Open Air Worker Emergency Fund
Accepting: Financial donations HERE
Providing:
During the ongoing wildfire emergency in Los Angeles County, Inclusive Action has launched a new emergency fund to help outdoor workers – street vendors, landscapers, and recyclers – impacted by the fires.

Through this fund, impacted outdoor workers can apply for one-time cash assistance support of $500. Recipients will receive cash payments on a first-come, first-served basis, and as funding allows.
Notes:
Apply by Friday, January 17 at 5 pm 
(May reopen in the future)

Name: Muir Heights
Accepting:
— Baby wipes
— Electric blankets
— Electric kettles
— HEPA air purifiers (DIY purifiers are nice but aren’t sufficient for an area next to the burn zone)
— P100 respirators
— N95 masks especially ones for children
— Hot plates
— Electric heaters

We anticipate there’s around 100 folks in need of these of the items, so the more, the merrier.
Providing: @ 4:30 pm for locals to pick up donations
Notes:
The quadrant of “Muir Heights” next to the Eaton fire burn zone needs extraordinary mutual aid support! 

This community of largely low-to-mid income Black & Latinx folks do not have many options to leave their homes and many do not have essential items to keep their homes safe. They also will not have gas to cook or heat their homes for at least another month.

Notes:
The Trauma Resource Institute (TRI) will be hosting weekly United for Healing Gatherings. Led by Elaine Miller-Karas and Dr. Michael Sapp, these 1-hour meetings are supportive and welcoming spaces designed to help community members who have experienced the devastating impact of wildfires in Southern California. These gatherings bring together survivors, first responders, and anyone impacted by the fires led by trauma and resiliency-informed facilitators to foster healing and hope.


First meeting will be conducted in English, with Spanish translation being added to subsequent meetings.

Name: The SAG-AFTRA Foundation Disaster Relief Fund
Providing:
Read in full:

To Qualify for Disaster Relief Fund Assistance, Members:

• Must be impacted by a natural disaster declared as an emergency by state or federal government agencies
• Must be current with SAG-AFTRA dues
• Are not eligible if they have any of the following SAG AFTRA membership statuses: Non-Member, Suspended Payment, Terminated, Resigned, or Fee Paying Non-Member (Fi-Core)
• Must be below the following liquid asset limits:

– For individuals, less than $10,000
– For applicants with spouses or dependents, less than $15,000
– Assets will be verified using recent bank statements
Notes: The SAG-AFTRA Foundation Disaster Relief Fund is a program designed to provide urgent financial assistance to SAG-AFTRA members who have been affected by a natural disaster.

Name: MusiCares

- $1,500 in Financial Assistance
- $500 grocery card

Eligibility:
Documentation of 3 years of work in music or 6 commercially released recordings or singles
Notes:
MusiCares is a resource to music professionals impacted by natural disasters, including the fires in the Los Angeles area. We provide short-term and long-term disaster relief related to evacuation and relocation costs, instrument replacement/repair, home damage, medical care, mental health services, & other essential living needs. Contact MusiCares to get started:**

Reach out for help: MusiCaresRelief@musicares.org  MusiCares’ expert staff treat cases with integrity and confidentiality. 

For those who have worked in the music industry for 5+ years, eligible for $1500 in financial assistance + $500 in food vouchers. Reach out to above contact information for more details.

Name: Bobbie
Accepting: Accepting funds to provided milk for families with babies impacted by fires. ($25 donations)
Providing:
free Bobbie formula for LA families who have lost their homes 
https://hibobbie.typeform.com/to/la9n1ELh?typeform-source=www.hibobbie.com
Notes:
Any parent - Bobbie customer or not — severely impacted by these fires can apply to have the rest of their feeding journey covered by Bobbie. As a team of moms we fiercely believe you should not have to worry about how to pay for formula while you figure out how to rebuild your entire life. Visit the link in bio to apply.
We are donating 1,000 cans to nonprofit and grassroots organizations who can immediately distribute donations on the ground. We will share locations as soon as we have them.
We are doing individual outreach to every subscriber in the impacted zip codes to understand what help they need during this time. If you need anything you can email us at hello@hibobbie.com
We are activating our Give a Can site for anyone to be able to donate a can of Bobbie to the parents in LA who need it. To help us give cans, visit the link in bio.

Providing:
If the cremated remains (cremains) of your loved ones were inside your home when it was destroyed by wildfire, help is available. A team of dedicated volunteer archaeologists, along with trained canines, is here to assist in recovering them with care and respect. Please visit the website to submit a service form. Also, please see the flyers for instructions on what to do to ensure the best chances of recovering your loved ones' cremains.

This is a FREE service provided exclusively for wildfire victims.
